title.narrative: Support to Implementation of the Bangladesh Delta Plan 2100 (SIBDP2100).

description.narrative:
The main aim of the SIBDP2100 project is to prepare and support the implementation of the Bangladesh Delta Plan 2100 by providing Policy Advice (including institutional development, funding strategy, river basin wise implementation programming) and Capacity Building (including communication and stakeholder participation, training, information and knowledge management).
The Bangladesh Delta Plan (BDP) 2100 focuses primarily on adaptation to climate change and on foodsecurity and economic development. The BDP2100 provides a long term vision, goals and strategies, an institutional framework and investment plan. It was formulated from 2014-2018 in a multi sectoral way by the General Economics Division, Planning Commision of the Ministry of Planning, supported by an international consortium led by Dutch consultancy firm Twynstra Gudde Holding B.V. The project was funded by the Government of the Netherlands. BDP2100 was approved by the National Economic Council (NEC), presided over by the Prime Minister and Chairperson of the NEC, on 4 September 2018. Bangladesh is the first country in the world to develop such a comprehensive multi-sectoral plan including an investment plan for the entire delta, using Adaptive Delta Management. The Government has assigned the General Economics Division (GED) the responsibility of the overall coordination, facilitation and monitoring of the BDP 2100 implementation.
The Government of the Kingdom of the Netherlands has extended the financial support to operationalize BDP2100 in a TA project, entitled "Support to the Implementation of the Bangladesh Delta Plan 2100 (SIBDP2100)". A team of consultants of the SIBDP consortium with lead partner Twynstra Gudde Holding B.V. has been engaged to support GED in its tasks of initiating and coordinating BDP2100 implementation with other ministries and implementing agencies, with effect from 1 October 2018. The consortium consists, besides Twynstra Gudde Holding B.V., of Deltares and Euroconsult Mott MacDonald and sub-contractors Institute of Water Modelling (IWM), Center for Environmental and Geographic Information Services (CEGIS) , Climate Adaptation Foundation (CAS).

activity-date.narrative: Planned end of the contract duration.
Starting date of the contract signed between SIBDP2100 consortium and the State of the Netherlands.

organisation.narrative:
Twynstra Gudde Holding B.V.
Twynstra Gudde Holding B.V. is an independent Dutch management consultancy firm, active in areas as water safety, security and governance; climate change adaptation including transformative policy making, master planning and implementation; infrastructure development and sustainable transportation; energy transition; spatial development. Characteristic advisory services are based on policy analysis, development and evaluation; strategic management and (long term) planning, transformation and strategic change; institutional analysis and development; leadership, organization structuring and change, program and project management, asset management, stakeholder participation. Training and capacity building programs are based on these skills and experiences.

mailing-address.narrative: Twynstra Gudde Holding B.V. Oliemolenhof 14a PO Box 907 3800 AX Amersfoort The Netherlands

recipient-country.narrative: Government of Bangladesh, Ministry of Planning: Planning Commission - General Economics Division.

description.narrative: Advance payment for SIBDP-expenditures, activity nr. 4000001489. (Ref. Invoice 7000023493 d.d. 2018-11-12).

provider-org.narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands - Dhaka.

sector.narrative: SIBDP focuses on implementation of Bangladesh Delta Plan 2100 aimed at adaptation to climate change and to natural disasters. The long term Plan deals with water safety & security, foodsecurity and socio-economic development and is linked to related policies and institutional arrangements.

description.narrative: The Inception Report SIBDP 2100 gives an overview of the approach the SIBDP project follows to support implementation of BDP2100. In addition, a Workplan has been elaborated.
Content related progress report on SIBDP activities and results over 2021.

The SIBDP Narrative Report 2020 presents activities carried out in 2020 on the 5 implementation capacities SIBDP focuses on for implementation of BDP2100. 3 Case descriptions are presented in the Report to give inside information of the implementation process and challenges.
SIBDP Annual Plan 2021 gives the work plan over 2021. The Report shows what already has been done on support to BDP2100 implementation and builds on this with actions for 2021.

SIBDP Annual Plan 2022 provides the overview of actions carried out and work packages on the 5 BDP2100 implementation capacities to be done in 2022. The Annual Plan also gives a risk assessment and budget information over 2022.

SIBDP Progress & Financial Report 2019 Presents the progress of SIBDP support after 1 year of start up and support to GED on implementation of BDP2100. Besides, a financial statement has been included.
The SIBDP Financial Report 2021 gives the overview of expenditures and financial statement over the year 2021.
BDP 2100 Abridged Version Bangla
Brief overview of BDP2100 background, delta vision and goals, strategies (National; Hotspot and Thematic) and measures in Bangla language.

title.narrative: Link to 26 Background Studies belonging to Bangladesh Delta Plan 2100

description.narrative: Under this link the 26 Background (Baseline) Studies behind Bangladesh Delta Plan 2100 can be found.
Under this link to the Planning Commission of Bangladesh, the Bangladesh Delta Plan 2100 can be downloaded.

SIBDP support consists of various forms of capacity building. The main focus of the project concerns enhancing the 5 following implementation capacities: 1. Institutional and Administrative Capacity 2. Connective and Organization Capacity 3. Knowledge and Learning Capacity 4. Funding Capacity 5. Natural System Adaptive Capacity
The focus of the Results on Capacity Building is on items 2 and 3, which have been elaborated in national and international training programme, workshops, fieldtrips as well as building capacity for knowledge management including an Information and Knowledge Portal and Knowledge Agenda.

title.narrative: SIBDP Annual Plan 2022. This document shows also progress on the various aspects of capacity building.

description.narrative:
Strengthening of main Delta Plan Institutions and Agencies
A Focal Point network has already been formed to support and promote coordination and collaboration of GED with involved ministries and agencies. A next step is required to anchor BDP2100 actions firmly by formation of Delta Cells. SIBDP supports defining the tasks and mandate, by further training, frequent Focal Point Meetings and requests for data exchange. Formation of Delta Cells means creating a unit in the involved ministries or agencies consisting of senior planning officials. Such a Delta Cell has been formed within BWDB. Some core implementation institutions, especially BWDB, DAE and LGED require assistance for BDP2100 implementation with a focus on: (a) BDP2100 content and funding; (b) the upcoming implementation tasks and (c) the needs of the organizations to make BDP implementation achievable. SIBDP will form working groups in which the BDP2100 Implementation Programs will be used for project selection and preparation (see also Par. 2.5.). A conference on BDP2100 implementation with 300 participants has been held together with BWDB on 27 October 2021 in which challenges and needs were identified. Besides, the Convention of Diploma Engineers and SIBDP organized a large Conference (750 participants) on BDP2100 and implementation implications. Further elaboration of the findings of both Conferences is required in 2022 to overcome continuing implementation issues e.g. at MoWR / BWDB in terms of readiness to implement which includes project preparation from Concept Notes to bankable projects. This also concerns the planning function of BWDB in relation to GED and WARPO. Moreover, an International Conference on BDP2100 Implementation will be held possibly 11 and 12 May 2022 to address implementation issues and to develop a meaningful course of action. SIBDP supports the preparation of this first International Conference and coordinates and contributes to the formulation of the Conference Paper.
Training
The responsibility for the implementation of the domestic trainings lies with GED. GED provided on-line trainings to Focal Points twice as well as on-line trainings for GoB officials. SIBDP assists in identifying and preparing the training modules and material and facilitating the online sessions. The three short international training courses in European countries or in Australia and two courses in Asian or African countries will be organized and funded by GoB. GED intends to arrange two International Certificate Courses. SIBDP supports identifying the suitable courses as soon as the Delta Wing has been formed. SIBDP provides in principle two international study tour/ training programs. In order to make international training effective, the events will be provided for the Delta Wing staff (possibly 2 events combined in 1 or a course to be arranged in Bangladesh). It is expected and in the budget as such included, that under the Covid19 circumstances international trainings will not be possible before the end of the SIBDP project on 30 September.
SIBDP provided training on Appraising BDP2100 and Adaptive Delta Management to 189 officers during FY 2020-2021 and 98 officers in FY 2021-2022. Technical and online support was provided to many meetings and workshops during the Covid19 period. Due to outbreak of Covid19, the pre-scheduled trainings, seminars and workshops by physical presence got postponed. However, using online platforms, SIBDP has completed 3 workshops, 2 workshops cum training and 8 short trainings (3-4 days training). Besides, SIBDP contributed significantly to the Conference on Blue Gold project; to the Conference on BDP2100 with BWDB (300 participants); the Conference on BDP2100 with the Convention of Diploma Engineers (900 participants).

The SIBDP Results overview gives an overview of deliverables and achievements already done or in progress. The overview focuses on 5 implementation capacities. Progress has been summarized under the 3 indicators of Policy Advice and 3 indicators of Capacity Building.
The Report over 2021 shows progres on the 5 Capacities and a risk analysis and possible measures to be taken.

SIBDP developed the training strategy and contents, provided trainings, developed training modules and supported to training by GED. For international training/ study tour, a tentative program has been prepared.

dimension.name: Increasing understanding and insights as well as knowledge of BDP 2100 and related concepts and Investment Plan

comment.narrative: Although BDP 2100 has been discussed with many ofiicials, experts and stakeholders during the formulation stage, there is a high demand to learn more about the Delta Plan. Especially the directly involved ministries and agencies including the Focal Point network needed to be trained and further involved. International training could not proceed due to Covid19 and related conditions.

title.narrative: Knowledge Management - knowledge development, sharing and accumulation

description.narrative: Knowledge Management has been adressed in the following ways. Knowledge development has taken place on all 5 Implementation Capacity areas in the form of data collection, analysis and reporting. Furthermore, setting knowledge available on request by GED or others, based on proper archiving and document management or by collecting information. The Knowledge and Information Portal has been updated and contains many data collections / layers and documents.

Reaching out to stakeholders by informing them based on video, borchures etc. and involving them in workshops, conferences and preparation of deliverables. Consultation took place in the form of workshops and Delta Ateliers during the Implementation Programming. Besides, officials of the implementing agencies including the Focal Point network were consulted on many occasions with respect to SIBDP activities and deliverables.

SIBDP supports implementation of BDP2100 in the form of Policy Advices on various with implementation related issues. Progress has been summarized on the indicators on Policy Advice The results up to April 2022 have been indicated in the document "SIBDP Results overview date May 2022" and in the SIBDP Progress Report over 2021. The results have been specified according to support on 5 Capacities: 1. Institutional and Administrative 2. Connective and Organization 3. Knowledge and Learning 4. Funding 5. National System Adaptive Capacity Policy Advice relates to 1, 4 and 5. See for elaboration of Indicators under Result Policy Advice and Result Capacity Building.

title.narrative: Result overview of SIBDP achievements as per May 2022.

description.narrative: Funding of BDP 2100 implementation is an urgent but complicated issue which has been addressed by SIBDP in a number of ways, e.g. GoB funding, IFI & DP-funding, PPP-funding, GCF-funding.

comment.narrative: Financing the BDP 2100 investment projects is being approached in two ways: 1) what is already in the pipeline contributing to the 6 delta goals; 2) which project should be funded and prepared into bankable projects asap e.g. linked with the priority package included in the 8th Five Year Plan.

description.narrative: SIBDP provided comprehensive institutional development to guide operationalization of implementation of BDP 2100 and to streamline implementation procedures. SIBDP delivered Policy Advice on many aspects of BDP2100 implementation, e.g. - Institutional arrangements regarding: Delta Wing, top decision making structure of Delta Governance Council, Program/ Project Selection Committee; Project Implementation Committee - Input to GED: 8th Five Year Plan; Medium - Long term consistency - Arrangement for Local/Regional Water Institutions - Climate change updating, in scenario’s, long term approach in programs/ projects - Longer term Delta Goals, Adaptiveness/ Policy Path Ways in 2100 perspective - Holistic and multi sectoral elaborations in programs and projects - Programs/ Projects considering transboundary impact/ relevance

dimension.name: Institutional Readiness for implementation of BDP 2100

comment.narrative: Institutional Readiness refers here to the level of readiness of government agencies to: i) deliver government services, ii) collaborate with other agencies in sharing data, systems and services for efficient service delivery and iii) engage stakeholders in government decision making and co-development of services. Institutional Readiness was low at the start of SIBDP. The BDP2100 already indicated requirements on institutional reform but the whole institutional framework needed to be elaborated and established.

description.narrative: in order to increase the Natural System Adaptive Capacity as indicated by BDP 2100 strategies and measures in relation to the identified Hotspots, the BDP 2100 implementation has been prepared with a basin wise programming approach to make implementation possible in a logical order and in its physical and socio-economic setting.

dimension.name: River Basin & Coastal Zone Implementation Programs

comment.narrative: The River Basin & Coastal Zone Implementation Programs needed to be developed in the setting of the Hotspots / Hydraulogical Regions. Attention has been paid to the state of the river basin/ sub-basins and socio-economic conditions as well as to stakeholder involvement with respect to investment proposals in line with BDP 2100 and the 8th Five Year Plan.
